text: saw the tool...ranted about it on one of the RPG groups I'm a part of...major tl;dr with a load of options on top of options...for a new player it's overwhelming...kinda like the D&D core books (Players Handbook, DMs Guild and Monster Manual...maybe not the Monster Manual).  Really disappointed...they could have designed it so much better and made it much more approachable for new players.  The rule nerds may like it, but to ask a new player to go make a new character...it feels like work...and it shouldn't...it should be fun with a mix of wonder and magic.
in my opinion D&D Beyond is a great study in overly complicated and confusing UIs with entirely to much content thrown at the user

attachments.title: Dungeons & Dragons Wouldn’t Be What It Is Today Without These Women
attachments.text: Almost every copy of the first Dungeons & Dragons adventure written by a woman is buried in a landfill in Lake Geneva, Wisconsin.
attachments.fallback: Kotaku: Dungeons & Dragons Wouldn’t Be What It Is Today Without These Women
